subject: Re: [junit] How to skip remaining tests when one test method in a TestCase fails?

messageBody:
On 4/19/06, cant_jim <Cant_jim@...> wrote:
>
> I'm writing a class (extending TestCase) which tests an object I get
> from a factory method. The first test method asks the Factory for the
> object and subsequent tests methods exercise the returned object.
>
> If any method fails, I know all the remaing ones will fail. How can I
> prevent the subsequent tests from being run? (I assume the test
> methods are invoked in the order the appear in the TestCase.)


This is a good example where dependent methods as provided by
TestNG<http://testng.org>would come in handy:

@Test
public void retrieveObject() {
m_object = Factory.getObject();
assertNotNull(m_object);
}

@Test(dependsOnMethods = "retrieveObject")
public void someTest() {
// test m_object
}

If everything goes well, you will get "2 PASSED, 0 FAILED". If the factory
fails to return the object, all the test methods that depend on
"retrieveObject" will be skipped and you will get "0 PASSED, 1 FAILED, 1
SKIP".

Note that dependent methods introduce a new status for your tests: on top
of PASS and FAIL, you now have SKIP, which indicates that this test didn't
run because its dependency could not be satisfied.

--
Cédric
http://testng.org
